item.description:
We will wrap up our reading of Kant with a number of his short essays. These essays will be a good closure what Kant wrote and thought about the "political" questions of his time and will lead us to the thinkers and works we are planning to read in the near future (e.g. Rousseau's Social Contract for the following meeting, please check out our NearFuturePlan file).

The essays for this meetings are:
1. What's Enlightenment? (http://www.english.up...)
2. Perpetual Peace (http://www.mtholyoke....)
3. Idea for a Universal History with a Cosmopolitan Purpose (http://www.marxists.o...)

Religion within the Limits of Reason Alone (http://www.hkbu.edu.h... ), this is a bigger work thanks to John Butler selections will be posted soon.
item.how_to_find_us: Ask for the philosophy group from the staff.
item.name: Wrap up session on Kant....
